post.description: Search contacts based on combinations of advanced filters. Documentation Link - https://doc.clickup.com/8631005/d/h/87cpx-158396/6e629989abe7fad

get.description:
Get Duplicate Contact.

If `Allow Duplicate Contact` is disabled under Settings, the global unique identifier will be used for searching the contact. If the setting is enabled, first priority for search is `email` and the second priority will be `phone`.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: Phone Number - Pass in URL Encoded form. i.e +1423164516 will become `%2B1423164516`

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Email - Pass in URL Encoded form. i.e test+abc@gmail.com will become `test%2Babc%40gmail.com`

post.description: Allows you to update tags to multiple contacts at once, you can add or remove tags from the contacts
Add/Remove Contacts From Business . Passing a `null` businessId will remove the businessId from the contacts

put.description: Please find the list of acceptable values for the `country` field here

post.description:
Please find the list of acceptable values for the `country` field here

The Upsert API will adhere to the configuration defined under the “Allow Duplicate Contact” setting at the Location level. If the setting is configured to check both Email and Phone, the API will attempt to identify an existing contact based on the priority sequence specified in the setting, and will create or update the contact accordingly.

If two separate contacts already exist—one with the same email and another with the same phone—and an upsert request includes both the email and phone, the API will update the contact that matches the first field in the configured sequence, and ignore the second field to prevent duplication.
Please find the list of acceptable values for the `country` field here

get.description:
Get Contacts

 **Note:** This API endpoint is deprecated. Please use the [Search Contacts](https://highlevel.stoplight.io/docs/integrations/dbe4f3a00a106-search-contacts) endpoint instead.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit Per Page records count. will allow maximum up to 100 and default will be 20

bearer.name: Authorization
bearer.description: Use the Access Token generated with user type as Sub-Account (OR) Private Integration Token of Sub-Account.

Location-Access.name: Authorization
Location-Access.description: Use the Access Token generated with user type as Sub-Account (OR) Private Integration Token of Sub-Account.

Location-Access-Only.name: Authorization
Location-Access-Only.description: Use the Access Token generated with user type as Sub-Account.

Agency-Access.name: Authorization
Agency-Access.description: Use the Access Token generated with user type as Agency (OR) Private Integration Token of Agency.

Agency-Access-Only.name: Authorization
Agency-Access-Only.description: Use the Access Token generated with user type as Agency.

contacts.description: list of contact ids to be processed

tags.description: list of tags to be added or removed

locationId.description: location id from where the bulk request is executed

removeAllTags.description: Option to implement remove all tags. if true, all tags will be removed from the contacts. Can only be used with remove type.

succeded.description: Indicates if the operation was successful

errorCount.description: Number of errors encountered during the operation

visitorId.description: visitorId is the Unique ID assigned to each Live chat visitor.

id.description: Pass either `id` or `key` of custom field

key.description: Pass either `id` or `key` of custom field

tags.description: This field will overwrite all current tags associated with the contact. To update a tags, it is recommended to use the Add Tag or Remove Tag API instead.
This field will overwrite all current tags associated with the contact. To update a tags, it is recommended to use the Add Tag or Remove Tag API instead.
